etymologies: early 19th century: named after General Henry Shrapnel (1761–1842), the British soldier who invented the shell; the sense ‘fragments of a bomb or shell’ originated during the First World War

definitions: fragments of a bomb, shell, or other object thrown out by an explosion.
shortDefinitions: fragments of bomb, shell, or other object thrown out by explosion

definitions: a shell containing bullets or pieces of metal timed to burst short of impact.
shortDefinitions: shell containing bullets or pieces of metal timed to burst short of impact
